spirit:register.spirit:name: CTRL
spirit:register.spirit:description: Control Register; used to configure the core.

spirit:register.spirit:name: STAT
spirit:register.spirit:description: Status Register; read-only value yields the current state of the core.

spirit:register.spirit:name: DATA
spirit:register.spirit:description: Data Register; read/write data to/from the serial IF.

spirit:register.spirit:name: ADDR0
spirit:register.spirit:description: Slave0 Address Register; contains the default Slave0 programmable address of the core.

spirit:register.spirit:name: SMB
spirit:register.spirit:description: Optional SMBus/IPMI Register; configuration register for SMBus timeout reset condition and for the optional SMBus signals SMBALERT_N and SMBSUS_N. Alternatively, enables/disables 3 ms IPMI SCL Low timeout.

spirit:register.spirit:name: ADDR1
spirit:register.spirit:description: Optional SLAVE1 Address Register; contains the optional SLAVE1 programmable address of the core. When this SLAVE1 address is fixed, the register will have a R/W bit to enable/disable SLAVE0 comparisons.

spirit:hwParameter.spirit:prompt: Generate SMBus Logic (Register, Timeouts, Bus Reset, and Alert/Suspend Signals):
Generate IPMI Logic (Register, and 3 ms SCL Low Timeout):
PCLK Frequency in MHz (Required to Calibrate Timeout Counters):

spirit:hwParameter.spirit:configGroups: Slave Address Options (for Tile Count Reduction and to Enable 2nd Address Decode Value):
Slave Address Options (for Tile Count Reduction and to Enable 2nd Address Decode Value):
Slave Address Options (for Tile Count Reduction and to Enable 2nd Address Decode Value):
Slave Address Options (for Tile Count Reduction and to Enable 2nd Address Decode Value):
Slave Address Options (for Tile Count Reduction and to Enable 2nd Address Decode Value):

spirit:enumeration.spirit:text: Full Master RX/TX, Slave RX/TX Modes (Largest Tile Count)
Master TX, Slave RX Modes For Write-Only Applications
Slave RX/TX Modes For Slave-Only Applications
Slave RX Mode For Slave RX-Only Applications (Smallest Tile Count)

spirit:vendorExtensions.actel-cc:description: CoreI2C provides an APB-driven serial interface, supporting I2C, SMBus, PMBus, and IPMI data transfers. Verilog/VHDL parameters are available to configure operation modes and minimize FPGA fabric area for a given application. CoreI2C allows for the generation of up to 16 I2C Channels per APB slot.
